fact_list.fact_text: Some junctions have an ALL RED period for safety or for pedestrians to cross.
During an ALL RED period, all approaches show red signals simultaneously.
Do not start to move until the green light appears.
Amber traffic light means 'STOP' unless you are too close to the stop-line to stop safely.
Flashing Amber traffic light means that traffic light signals are out of order.
Flashing Amber signals indicate to proceed with caution and give way to traffic on the right.
Before proceeding on a Green light, look to the right and left to ensure it is safe.
Green Arrow traffic light means 'GO' in the direction indicated after ensuring oncoming traffic is clear.
Flickering Green Arrow means the signal is about to be cancelled.
Do not proceed on a Flickering Green Arrow signal if you have not crossed the stop-line.
